p: D. melanogaster (Harwich strain) flies were obtained from the National Species Stock Center, Bowling Green, OH. The flies were raised in 330 mL glass bottles (15 cm in height and 6.5 cm in diameter), cultured with a medium containing: (83% corn mass, 4% sugar, 4% lyophilized milk, 4% soy bran, 4% wheat bran and 1% salt), 1 g of Nipagin (Methylparaben) and 1 mL of a solution containing Saccharomyces cerevisiae. The flies were kept at a temperature of 25 Â°C with a relative humidity of 60% [ 23]. All experiments were performed with the same strain.
